rules.rule_name: Allowable protrusion for Television and radio antennas
rules.source_text: Feature: Television and radio antennas | Allowable protrusion: up to 15' above maximum building height

qualifiers.applicability: Applies to Television and radio antennas.

variables.name: protrusion_height_above_building_height
variables.description: The height the antenna extends above the maximum building height limit.

constants.name: max_protrusion_height_above_building_height
constants.description: Maximum allowable protrusion height above the building height limit.

dependencies: Depends on the 'maximum building height' regulation for the specific building.

relationships.hierarchical: This rule is a sub-part of the 'Allowable daylight plane protrusions' regulation.
logical_dependencies: The calculation requires the value of 'maximum building height' from another regulation.

rules.rule_name: Allowable protrusion for Chimneys and flues
rules.source_text: Feature: Chimneys and flues < 5' wide | Allowable protrusion: may extend beyond the daylight plane to meet minimum required clearance of Building Code (Chapter 16.04)

qualifiers.applicability: Applies to Chimneys and flues with a width less than 5 feet.

variables.name: feature_width
variables.description: The width of the chimney or flue.

variables.name: protrusion_extent
variables.description: The extent to which the feature protrudes beyond the daylight plane.

constants.name: max_width_for_applicability
constants.description: The maximum width for a chimney or flue to qualify for this protrusion rule.

constants.name: referenced_code
constants.description: External code defining minimum required clearance.

optional: If feature_width < 5 feet, the feature 'may extend' beyond the daylight plane to meet code requirements.

conditional_logic.then: protrusion_extent is allowed up to the 'minimum required clearance' specified in Building Code (Chapter 16.04).

dependencies: The maximum allowable protrusion depends on the 'minimum required clearance' defined in Building Code (Chapter 16.04).

exceptions.deviation: May extend beyond the daylight plane, unlike other features, but only to meet a specific external code requirement.

relationships.hierarchical: This rule is a sub-part of the 'Allowable daylight plane protrusions' regulation.

rules.rule_name: Allowable protrusion for Dormers, roof decks, gables, or similar architectural features
rules.source_text: Feature: Dormers, roof decks, gables, or similar architectural features | Allowable protrusion: each feature ≤ 7.5' long and cumulative length of all features ≤ 15' with min 5' separation between features (on each side); height ≤ 24';

qualifiers.applicability: Applies to Dormers, roof decks, gables, or similar architectural features.

variables.name: individual_feature_length
variables.description: The length of a single dormer, roof deck, or gable.

variables.name: cumulative_feature_length_per_side
variables.description: The sum of lengths of all such features on one side of the building.

variables.name: separation_between_features
variables.description: The minimum distance between adjacent features on the same side.

dependencies: The 'cumulative_feature_length_per_side' is dependent on the number and length of all individual features of this type on a given side.
The 'separation_between_features' rule is dependent on the presence of more than one feature on a given side.

relationships.hierarchical: This rule is a sub-part of the 'Allowable daylight plane protrusions' regulation.
logical_dependencies: All four dimensional constraints (individual length, cumulative length, separation, height) must be met simultaneously for the protrusion to be compliant.

ambiguous_language.reason: The text explicitly notes this is unclear. It is not specified what 'height' refers to (e.g., height above roof line, total height of the feature, height of the protrusion into the plane).

rules.rule_name: Allowable protrusion for Cornices, eaves, and similar architectural features
rules.source_text: Feature: Cornices, eaves, and similar architectural features (excluding flat or continuous walls or enclosures usable for interior space) | Allowable protrusion: max 2'

qualifiers.applicability: Applies to Cornices, eaves, and similar architectural features.

variables.name: protrusion_depth
variables.description: The depth of the protrusion from the building face into the daylight plane.

variables.name: is_usable_interior_space
variables.description: A boolean indicating if the feature encloses space that can be used as interior living/working area.

variables.name: is_flat_continuous_wall
variables.description: A boolean indicating if the feature is a flat or continuous wall.

conditional_logic.then: This rule does not apply; the feature is not a valid protrusion under this rule.

relationships.hierarchical: This rule is a sub-part of the 'Allowable daylight plane protrusions' regulation.
